EXIT   X

MONITORING AND REPORTING OBLIGATIONS

Page

Table of Contents

 

A suspicious transaction or matter is unusual and inconsistent with that customer's normal business activities. Here are some ways to determine whether transactions are suspicious:

 

Click on the terms below for more details

Consider the types of transactions your customers regularly undertake. For example, if a customer regularly makes small cash deposits at his or her local bank branch, then a large and unexplained electronic funds transfer is suspicious.

Business profiling may uncover suspect corporate financings. For example, large loans from offshore jurisdictions to a small local business might arouse your suspicion.

Profiling customers and their businesses to determine what a normal transaction is for them.

Monitor customer account activity and transaction behaviour under your ongoing customer due diligence obligations for any patterns or unusual transactions.
